column4: my ubuntu 10.04.1 wont start, i get a black page with BusyBox v1.13.3(Ubuntu …….) (initramfs) any body had this problem or know how to fix it?
can you Ctrl+Alt+F1 and get to a terminal?
Ugh... can oyu boot to a live cd and look at logs?
i am on a live cd right now how do i see the logs?
i am on a live cd right now how do i see the logs?
mount up the / of your installed ubuntu (I usually just put it in /mnt)  so sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sda1 /mnt
so long as /dev/sda1 is your root partition.  Then the logs would be in /mnt/var/log/
i got: mount: /dev/sda2 already mounted or /mnt busy
just type mount and what are the last couple of entries?
binfmt_misc on /proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc type binfmt..... and gvfs-fuse-daemon on /home/ubuntu/.gvfs type fuse.gvfs-fuse....
no /dev/sda2 anywhere?
nop /dev/sda2 is not there
do u think there is a way i can access my files from the live cd?
hrmmmm  But it's busy when you try to mount it....  Yes, I totally think you can get at them from the livecd
did you try mounting sda1?
sda1 gives me mount:wrong fs type, bad option ...
sudo fdisk /dev/sda  When you get to Command (m for help):  type a lowercase p and hit enter.
oh, forget it.  If you're already there, hit q to quit.
yes i got something
what's df -T say?
sudo df -t /dev/sda1
i got no file system processed
meh?
u said u know how to get my files from a live cd?
